channel.title: BuddyTV
channel.description: BuddyTV - TV News, Spoilers, Pictures, Profiles, Forums, and Live Commentary

item.title: Buddy Battles Semifinals: Ryan and Esposito vs. Brennan and Angela!
item.description: The Buddy Battles have been raging hard all March and we're coming down to the wire! Soon we'll be crowning your favorite dynamic duo, but first there's another pair ready to battle it out in the semifinal round.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'Psych' 100th Episode Celebration and Set Photos
item.description:
Psych is celebrating their 100th episode this week with the highly anticipated "Clue." On May 31st, 2012, the Psych cast and crew celebrated achieving their 100th episode.

Check out photos taken during the Psych cast and crew celebration, as well as, photos taken of the Psych Santa Barbara Police Department set.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'The Following' Video Sneak Peeks: Claire's in Danger on 'Guilt'
item.description: On The Following, Joe's Followers have failed twice to capture Claire, will they succeed on their third attempt? Or, will Ryan and the FBI be able to protect her? It's all going to come down to timing. Meanwhile, Joe uses his incredible manipulation skills to get closer to his son, Joey. FOX has released four sneak peeks and a preview video for "Guilt." Check them out!
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'Psych' Interview: Timothy Omundson and Maggie Lawson Tease 100th Episode, Musical Episode and More
item.description: USA's hit series, Psych, celebrates its 100th episode on Wednesday March 27 with a special episode called "100 Clues." BuddyTV was on the line when stars Timothy Omundson and Maggie Lawson sat down to talk about what it was like to film the 100th episode, and give details on what fans can expect from the rest of Psych season 7.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'Dancing with the Stars' Week 2 Preview: Time to Jazz It Up
item.description: Fans got their first look at the season 16 cast of Dancing with the Stars in action last week. While none of the contestants blew the judges away, a number of the celebrity dancers put forth strong first showings.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'Kardashians' Roundup: Kim Shares Acupuncture Photo, Talks Weight Gain and Baby Names
item.description: After admitting that her pregnancy is not all sunshine and roses, Kim Kardashian appears to be looking for ways to de-stress. Her idea of relaxation, however, is quite different from what you would expect.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'Revenge' Winners and Losers from 'Victory'
item.description: Not everyone can be a winner on Revenge and this week was no exception. Check out the winners and losers from "Victory." The red marker did make a return!
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'The Amazing Race' Week 6 Likeability Rankings: Max and Katie Can't Back Up Their Arrogance
item.description:
On week six of The Amazing Race, Bates and Anthony took the lead, while Max and Katie caught a big break. The arrogant newlyweds came in last place, but luckily for them, week six wasn?t an elimination round. This was disappointing considering they once again find themselves in last place in the likeability rankings.

Download the BuddyTV Guide app now so you can follow all the latest happenings on The Amazing Race this season.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'The Good Wife' Recap: The Cardinal Rules of Love and Politics
item.description:
In this universe, Fringe has left the air. But in the universe of The Good Wife, John Noble returns as one of Alicia's more eccentric clients, and it's great to have him back.

If we didn't get the Good Wife/Fringe crossover episode of our dreams, we still have one of the best episodes of an extremely strong season 4. Besides a stellar roster of guest stars and a chance to hear Alicia compare a political rival to Hitler, we may even have learned who's won Alicia's heart once and for all.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'Once Upon a Time': 19 Shocking Moments from 'Selfless, Brave and True'
item.description: In shocking Once Upon a Time fashion, secrets were revealed in "Selfless, Brave and True" that threaten Storybrooke.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'The Real Housewives of Atlanta' Recap: Battling Booty Shoots
item.description:
As this week's RHOA starts, we're right in the middle of a Kenya flip-out as she desperately tries to exit Kandi's party. She's yelling at Kandi's manager to get the other cars out of her way or she will "run them over." Yikes. Chill out, girl. He's not chasing after you. You want to remove yourself from the situation. We get it.

Roundup: Reunion Spoilers, Yet Another Lawsuit and a Possible Engagement >>>

Walter-Obsessed

Cynthia is sick of it as well, so she decides to sit down with Kenya and be honest about her recent behavior with the whole Walter situation. Kenya is so fixated on Walter being obsessed with her that it's making her look insane. This is not exactly what Cynthia tells her, but she gets her point across without Kenya getting overly defensive. Which is really kind of amazing. Cynthia is right. Who cares who Walter is dating? Who cares if he keeps showing up? If you lost interest in him, Kenya, he shouldn't be on your radar.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'Once Upon a Time' Recap: Finding Redemption in Storybrooke
item.description: Wow. Once Upon a Time was a packed hour of shocking reveals which presented many more questions than answers. On "Selfless, Brave, and True," August's past was revealed to be selfish, and less than brave or true. And, even more importantly a run-in he had years prior has arrived in Storybrooke with a seemingly malicious plan and unexpected partner.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'All-Star Celebrity Apprentice' Recap: Dreadlocked Stars and Stripes
item.description: Welcome, friends. Let us suffer through another Omarosa-ridden episode after LaToya Jackson made one of the dumbest decisions in the history of the Apprentice boardrooms and now we must all suffer.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'The Walking Dead' Recap: Merle's Redemptive Act
item.description: The Walking Dead delivered a cliffhanger two episode ago regarding if Rick would turn Michonne over to the Governor. It felt more like the last step on a flight of stairs rather than a giant cliff. The end game has always appeared to be Rick's crew vs. the Governor's crew. The "Will Rick betray Michonne?" question seemed to have the obvious answer of "No" and to be a plot element to just drag things out to the finale. I was right about Rick's decision, but "This Sorrowful Life" offers up some huge plot and character developments.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'Revenge' Recap: Is There Another Grayson?
item.description:
This week on Revenge, Eli is still around causing problems for Emily, Nolan's plan to help Padma goes sideways and there's yet another shocking Grayson revelation.

ABC Announces Season Finale Dates for Spring 2013 >>>

Plus, Jack continues his own quest for revenge, but his poker face isn't quite as good as Emily's. The ability to go from sweetly sincere to evil glare in under five seconds is a skill it takes a lifetime to achieve. Nice try Jack, but not quite.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'The Amazing Race' Recap: I Wanna Botswana
item.description: This week on The Amazing Race, teams get tribal in search of scorpios, fire and traps. What is this, Survivor?
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'Revenge' Video Sneak Peeks: Threats are Made on 'Victory'
item.description: The Initiative has both Daniel and Padma under their control on Revenge. Will either or both of them find a way to get free now that Emily, Nolan and Aiden are on their side? On "Victory," there are threats, an abduction, a prison visit, and the preview promises a shocker. You won't want to miss the sneak peeks!
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'Once Upon a Time' Video Sneak Peeks: Pains of the Past on 'Selfless, Brave and True'
item.description: Cora's dead, Mary Margaret's heart is turning black, and the young Owen has returned as an adult to find his father on Once Upon a Time. And, those are only a few of the challenges facing the Storybrooke residents right now. In "Selfless, Brave and True," August returns in the past and in the present. And, another outsider shows up in Storybrooke. Is the town become a "theme park" as Emma calls it?
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'The Vampire Diaries' Video Sneak Peeks: Still Searching for the Cure on 'American Gothic'
item.description: The search for the cure continues on The Vampire Diaries. Will it ever be used? Or, will it continue to be that mystical thing out there that everyone wants? On "American Gothic," the quest lands Elena, Rebekah, Stefan, and Damon all in a small town in Pennsylvania. Will Katherine be able to keep the cure out of their hands?
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: Everything You Need to Know About the Characters of 'Revolution' (So Far)
item.description:
It is almost time, Revolution fans. On Monday, the show will return from a lengthy four month hiatus. But for those unfamiliar with the world and its inhabitants -- or those who just need a refresher -- this slideshow provides important details about the show?s key characters. Keep reading for more information on the Mathesons -- the show?s core family -- and their friends, allies and enemies.

Also See: Highlights from the the first half of season one.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'Idol' Roundup: Nicki Minaj Wants Jimmy Iovine to 'Zip His Lips'
item.description: In one corner, it's Jimmy Iovine. In the other, the judges of season 12. After Jimmy's scathing lecture to the judges, Nicki Minaj and Randy Jackson are hitting back hard. Also in today's Roundup, the music video for Jessica Sanchez's single "Tonight" has been released (and listen to a preview of her album), and Phillip Phillips saw an increase in sales of his album and single after his appearance on Idol.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'The Voice' Blind Audition Video: Christian Porter Is Sexy and He Knows It
item.description: Are you ready to get sexy? The Voice premieres Monday, March 25 at 8pm on NBC, and with it comes a performer who might have what it takes to go very far. In this new video, we get to see the season 4 blind audition of Christian Porter, and it's pretty darn amazing.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: ?Game of Thrones? Rewind: Where We Left Off After Season 2
item.description: With so much going on in the Seven Kingdoms, here is where all the major characters were left at the end of Game of Thrones season 2.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'Revolution' Interview: EP Eric Kripke and Star Elizabeth Mitchell Tease Secrets To Be Revealed
item.description:
The return of Revolution is on the other side of the weekend and promises to be explosive. Rachel has been reunited with her family and Monroe is determined to take them out. Executive Producer Eric Kripke and star Elizabeth Mitchell spoke with reporters recently on a call about what's coming up now that the group dynamic has changed.

They discuss secrets that will be revealed and how relationships will be challenged in the below edited excerpts from the interview.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com

item.title: 'Castle' Exclusive Interview with Seamus Dever: 'People Think They Know Ryan, But They Really Don't'
item.description: Castle season 5 continues on Monday, March 25 with an episode called "The Wild Rover" that is sure to become an instant favorite with fans of one Detective Kevin Ryan. BuddyTV spoke exclusively with Seamus Dever about what will happen to Ryan when a case from his past as a narcotics cop comes back to haunt him.
item.author: editor@buddytv.com
